original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs.140 bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields fell across maturities at Wednesday’s auction while all offered 140 billion bills were sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office accepted 60 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 17.79 percent, fell by 521 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 60 billion rupees.
40 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 15.93 percent, fell by 356 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion rupees.
40 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 13.86 percent, fell by 313 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion. (Colombo/July05/2023)
